707130f-b.title: Brooklyn: Union St. - Van Brunt St.
707130f-b.text:
(1)
63-67 Union Street, at the N.E. corner of Van Brunt Street, showing
on Union Street, a demolished building once No. 65. Surrounding the
4-story tenement, is the site upon which once stood William H. Mair's
wall paper factory. In the background is shown, Nos. 65 and 67 Sacket t
Street.
March 27, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, further eastward, showing the demolished wall paper fac-
tory of William H. Mair. In the background across the clearing, are
Noe. 89-93 Sackett Street, and at the right, the rears of a series of
3-story structdres, facing on the south side of Sackett Street.
March 27, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
707130f-b.folder: Union St. & Van Brunt St., Brooklyn, NY
